page.title: 02INRODUCTION
page.content: Home life today in villages on the North Norfolk Coast.Sea Palling, Hempstead and Eccles. This is an area of North Norfolk Coast including part of the village of Sea Palling, the hamlet of Eccles and a small settlement known as the Bush Estate. The land which had traditionally been grazing marsh is now almost entirely arable. The remainder of the area is coastal dune and marrams. The village of Sea Palling is mainly residential, it's population is swelled in summer by holidaymakers mainly accommodated in the caravan sites in the area. The village lies on low land behind the dunes and in the past has been subject to sea flooding, but now has a concrete wall beneath the dunes to defend it from the North Sea.
